--- title: Baja Species 2 description: --Giant Cardon Cacti author: RJ Cody Markelz date: 2022-12-07 categories: [GIS, data, trail run, hike, explore, photography, nature journal, zine, adventure, GBIF, baja, mexico, cacti] image: /images/cardon-cacti-map.png ---

# Introduction The [Crested caracara's](Crested Caracaras) I talked about in my [last post](/posts/2022-12-01-baja-species/index.html) are sitting on top of a [Giant Cardon Cacti (Pachycereus pringlei)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pachycereus_pringlei). I wanted to take a look to see if the cacti were as widely distributed in the area as the Caracaras. ### Load the libraries ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(rgbif) library(sf) library(tidyverse) library(rnaturalearth) library(rnaturalearthdata) ``` ::: Subset our search to only Southern Baja Sur. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} baja_geometry <- paste('POLYGON((-112.632285206 22.4136232805, -109.1001807138 22.4136232805, -109.1001807138 25.4259663625, -112.632285206 25.4259663625, -112.632285206 22.4136232805))') cacti <- occ_data(scientificName = "Pachycereus pringlei", hasCoordinate = TRUE, limit = 10000, geometry = baja_geometry ) cacti_coords <- cacti$data[ , c("decimalLongitude", "decimalLatitude", "individualCount", "occurrenceStatus", "coordinateUncertaintyInMeters", "institutionCode", "references")] ``` ::: I subset the larger dataset to just zoom in on Mexico and plot the appoximate location where my observation was. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} cacti_obs <- data.frame(decimalLongitude = c(-110.18917658541324), decimalLatitude = c(23.369598786877447)) world_maps <- ne_countries(scale = "medium", returnclass = "sf") mexico <- subset(world_maps, name == "Mexico") ggplot(data = mexico) + geom_sf() + geom_point(data = cacti_obs, aes(x = decimalLongitude, y = decimalLatitude), color = 'red') ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: Zoom into the Baja penninsula and plot all the points. There have been many observations of both the Giant Cardon Cacti and the Crested caracara all over the general region I visited. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} theme_set(theme_bw()) ggplot(data = mexico) + geom_sf() + geom_point(data = cacti_coords, aes(x = decimalLongitude, y = decimalLatitude), color = 'blue') + geom_point(data = cacti_obs, aes(x = decimalLongitude, y = decimalLatitude), color = 'red') ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(data = mexico) + geom_sf() + geom_point(data = cacti_coords, aes(x = decimalLongitude, y = decimalLatitude), color = 'blue') + geom_point(data = cacti_obs, aes(x = decimalLongitude, y = decimalLatitude), color = 'red') + coord_sf(xlim = c(-115, -109), ylim = c(22.5, 27), expand = TRUE) + xlab("Longitude") + ylab("Latitude") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-2.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} ggsave("~/DATA/images/cardon-cacti-map.png") ``` :::
